00055 static void seq_server_proc_fini(struct lu_server_seq *seq);
00056 
00057 /* Assigns client to sequence controller node. */
00058 int seq_server_set_cli(const struct lu_env *env, struct lu_server_seq *seq,
00059                        struct lu_client_seq *cli)
00060 {
00061         int rc = 0;
00062         ENTRY;
00063 
00064         /*
00065          * Ask client for new range, assign that range to ->seq_space and write
00066          * seq state to backing store should be atomic.
00067          */
00068         mutex_lock(&seq->lss_mutex);
00069 
00070         if (cli == NULL) {
00071                 CDEBUG(D_INFO, "%s: Detached sequence client\n", seq->lss_name);
00072                 seq->lss_cli = NULL;
00073                 GOTO(out_up, rc = 0);
00074         }
00075 
00076         if (seq->lss_cli != NULL) {
00077                 CDEBUG(D_HA, "%s: Sequence controller is already "
00078                        "assigned\n", seq->lss_name);
00079                 GOTO(out_up, rc = -EEXIST);
00080         }
00081 
00082         CDEBUG(D_INFO, "%s: Attached sequence controller %s\n",
00083                seq->lss_name, cli->lcs_name);
00084 
00085         seq->lss_cli = cli;
00086         cli->lcs_space.lsr_index = seq->lss_site->ss_node_id;
00087         EXIT;
00088 out_up:
00089         mutex_unlock(&seq->lss_mutex);
00090         return rc;
00091 }
00092 EXPORT_SYMBOL(seq_server_set_cli);
00093 /*
00094  * allocate \a w units of sequence from range \a from.
00095  */
00096 static inline void range_alloc(struct lu_seq_range *to,
00097                                struct lu_seq_range *from,
00098                                __u64 width)
00099 {
00100         width = min(lu_seq_range_space(from), width);
00101         to->lsr_start = from->lsr_start;
00102         to->lsr_end = from->lsr_start + width;
00103         from->lsr_start += width;
00104 }
00105 
00113 static int __seq_server_alloc_super(struct lu_server_seq *seq,
00114                                     struct lu_seq_range *out,
00115                                     const struct lu_env *env)
00116 {
00117         struct lu_seq_range *space = &seq->lss_space;
00118         int rc;
00119         ENTRY;
00120 
00121         LASSERT(lu_seq_range_is_sane(space));
00122 
00123         if (lu_seq_range_is_exhausted(space)) {
00124                 CERROR("%s: Sequences space is exhausted\n",
00125                        seq->lss_name);
00126                 RETURN(-ENOSPC);
00127         } else {
00128                 range_alloc(out, space, seq->lss_width);
00129         }
00130 
00131         rc = seq_store_update(env, seq, out, 1 /* sync */);
00132 
00133         LCONSOLE_INFO("%s: super-sequence allocation rc = %d " DRANGE"\n",
00134                       seq->lss_name, rc, PRANGE(out));
00135 
00136         RETURN(rc);
00137 }
00138 
00139 int seq_server_alloc_super(struct lu_server_seq *seq,
00140                            struct lu_seq_range *out,
00141                            const struct lu_env *env)
00142 {
00143         int rc;
00144         ENTRY;
00145 
00146         mutex_lock(&seq->lss_mutex);
00147         rc = __seq_server_alloc_super(seq, out, env);
00148         mutex_unlock(&seq->lss_mutex);
00149 
00150         RETURN(rc);
00151 }
00152 
00153 int seq_server_alloc_spec(struct lu_server_seq *seq,
00154                           struct lu_seq_range *spec,
00155                           const struct lu_env *env)
00156 {
00157         struct lu_seq_range *space = &seq->lss_space;
00158         int rc = -ENOSPC;
00159         ENTRY;
00160 
00161         /*
00162          * In some cases (like recovery after a disaster)
00163          * we may need to allocate sequences manually
00164          * Notice some sequences can be lost if requested
00165          * range doesn't start at the beginning of current
00166          * free space. Also notice it's not possible now
00167          * to allocate sequences out of natural order.
00168          */
00169         if (spec->lsr_start >= spec->lsr_end)
00170                 RETURN(-EINVAL);
00171         if (spec->lsr_flags != LU_SEQ_RANGE_MDT &&
00172             spec->lsr_flags != LU_SEQ_RANGE_OST)
00173                 RETURN(-EINVAL);
00174 
00175         mutex_lock(&seq->lss_mutex);
00176         if (spec->lsr_start >= space->lsr_start) {
00177                 space->lsr_start = spec->lsr_end;
00178                 rc = seq_store_update(env, seq, spec, 1 /* sync */);
00179 
00180                 LCONSOLE_INFO("%s: "DRANGE" sequences allocated: rc = %d \n",
00181                               seq->lss_name, PRANGE(spec), rc);
00182         }
00183         mutex_unlock(&seq->lss_mutex);
00184 
00185         RETURN(rc);
00186 }
00187 
00188 static int __seq_set_init(const struct lu_env *env,
00189                             struct lu_server_seq *seq)
00190 {
00191         struct lu_seq_range *space = &seq->lss_space;
00192         int rc;
00193 
00194         range_alloc(&seq->lss_lowater_set, space, seq->lss_set_width);
00195         range_alloc(&seq->lss_hiwater_set, space, seq->lss_set_width);
00196 
00197         rc = seq_store_update(env, seq, NULL, 1);
00198 
00199         return rc;
00200 }
00201 
00202 /*
00203  * This function implements new seq allocation algorithm using async
00204  * updates to seq file on disk. ref bug 18857 for details.
00205  * there are four variable to keep track of this process
00206  *
00207  * lss_space; - available lss_space
00208  * lss_lowater_set; - lu_seq_range for all seqs before barrier, i.e. safe to use
00209  * lss_hiwater_set; - lu_seq_range after barrier, i.e. allocated but may be
00210  *                    not yet committed
00211  *
00212  * when lss_lowater_set reaches the end it is replaced with hiwater one and
00213  * a write operation is initiated to allocate new hiwater range.
00214  * if last seq write opearion is still not committed, current operation is
00215  * flaged as sync write op.
00216  */
00217 static int range_alloc_set(const struct lu_env *env,
00218                            struct lu_seq_range *out,
00219                            struct lu_server_seq *seq)
00220 {
00221         struct lu_seq_range *space = &seq->lss_space;
00222         struct lu_seq_range *loset = &seq->lss_lowater_set;
00223         struct lu_seq_range *hiset = &seq->lss_hiwater_set;
00224         int rc = 0;
00225 
00226         if (lu_seq_range_is_zero(loset))
00227                 __seq_set_init(env, seq);
00228 
00229         if (OBD_FAIL_CHECK(OBD_FAIL_SEQ_ALLOC)) /* exhaust set */
00230                 loset->lsr_start = loset->lsr_end;
00231 
00232         if (lu_seq_range_is_exhausted(loset)) {
00233                 /* reached high water mark. */
00234                 struct lu_device *dev = seq->lss_site->ss_lu->ls_top_dev;
00235                 int obd_num_clients = dev->ld_obd->obd_num_exports;
00236                 __u64 set_sz;
00237 
00238                 /* calculate new seq width based on number of clients */
00239                 set_sz = max(seq->lss_set_width,
00240                              obd_num_clients * seq->lss_width);
00241                 set_sz = min(lu_seq_range_space(space), set_sz);
00242 
00243                 /* Switch to hiwater range now */
00244                 *loset = *hiset;
00245                 /* allocate new hiwater range */
00246                 range_alloc(hiset, space, set_sz);
00247 
00248                 /* update ondisk seq with new *space */
00249                 rc = seq_store_update(env, seq, NULL, seq->lss_need_sync);
00250         }
00251 
00252         LASSERTF(!lu_seq_range_is_exhausted(loset) ||
00253                  lu_seq_range_is_sane(loset),
00254                  DRANGE"\n", PRANGE(loset));
00255 
00256         if (rc == 0)
00257                 range_alloc(out, loset, seq->lss_width);
00258 
00259         RETURN(rc);
00260 }
00261 
00275 int seq_server_check_and_alloc_super(const struct lu_env *env,
00276                                      struct lu_server_seq *seq)
00277 {
00278         struct lu_seq_range *space = &seq->lss_space;
00279         int rc = 0;
00280 
00281         ENTRY;
00282 
00283         /* Check if available space ends and allocate new super seq */
00284         if (lu_seq_range_is_exhausted(space)) {
00285                 if (!seq->lss_cli) {
00286                         CERROR("%s: No sequence controller is attached.\n",
00287                                seq->lss_name);
00288                         RETURN(-ENODEV);
00289                 }
00290 
00291                 rc = seq_client_alloc_super(seq->lss_cli, env);
00292                 if (rc) {
00293                         CDEBUG(D_HA, "%s: Can't allocate super-sequence:"
00294                               " rc %d\n", seq->lss_name, rc);
00295                         RETURN(rc);
00296                 }
00297 
00298                 /* Saving new range to allocation space. */
00299                 *space = seq->lss_cli->lcs_space;
00300                 LASSERT(lu_seq_range_is_sane(space));
00301                 if (seq->lss_cli->lcs_srv == NULL) {
00302                         struct lu_server_fld *fld;
00303 
00304                         /* Insert it to the local FLDB */
00305                         fld = seq->lss_site->ss_server_fld;
00306                         mutex_lock(&fld->lsf_lock);
00307                         rc = fld_insert_entry(env, fld, space);
00308                         mutex_unlock(&fld->lsf_lock);
00309                 }
00310         }
00311 
00312         if (lu_seq_range_is_zero(&seq->lss_lowater_set))
00313                 __seq_set_init(env, seq);
00314 
00315         RETURN(rc);
00316 }
00317 EXPORT_SYMBOL(seq_server_check_and_alloc_super);
00318 
00319 static int __seq_server_alloc_meta(struct lu_server_seq *seq,
00320                                    struct lu_seq_range *out,
00321                                    const struct lu_env *env)
00322 {
00323         struct lu_seq_range *space = &seq->lss_space;
00324         int rc = 0;
00325 
00326         ENTRY;
00327 
00328         LASSERT(lu_seq_range_is_sane(space));
00329 
00330         rc = seq_server_check_and_alloc_super(env, seq);
00331         if (rc < 0) {
00332                 CERROR("%s: Allocated super-sequence failed: rc = %d\n",
00333                         seq->lss_name, rc);
00334                 RETURN(rc);
00335         }
00336 
00337         rc = range_alloc_set(env, out, seq);
00338         if (rc != 0) {
00339                 CERROR("%s: Allocated meta-sequence failed: rc = %d\n",
00340                         seq->lss_name, rc);
00341                 RETURN(rc);
00342         }
00343 
00344         CDEBUG(D_INFO, "%s: Allocated meta-sequence " DRANGE"\n",
00345                 seq->lss_name, PRANGE(out));
00346 
00347         RETURN(rc);
00348 }
00349 
00350 int seq_server_alloc_meta(struct lu_server_seq *seq,
00351                           struct lu_seq_range *out,
00352                           const struct lu_env *env)
00353 {
00354         int rc;
00355         ENTRY;
00356 
00357         mutex_lock(&seq->lss_mutex);
00358         rc = __seq_server_alloc_meta(seq, out, env);
00359         mutex_unlock(&seq->lss_mutex);
00360 
00361         RETURN(rc);
00362 }
00363 EXPORT_SYMBOL(seq_server_alloc_meta);
00364 
00365 static int seq_server_handle(struct lu_site *site,
00366                              const struct lu_env *env,
00367                              __u32 opc, struct lu_seq_range *out)
00368 {
00369         int rc;
00370         struct seq_server_site *ss_site;
00371         ENTRY;
00372 
00373         ss_site = lu_site2seq(site);
00374 
00375         switch (opc) {
00376         case SEQ_ALLOC_META:
00377                 if (!ss_site->ss_server_seq) {
00378                         CERROR("Sequence server is not "
00379                                "initialized\n");
00380                         RETURN(-EINVAL);
00381                 }
00382                 rc = seq_server_alloc_meta(ss_site->ss_server_seq, out, env);
00383                 break;
00384         case SEQ_ALLOC_SUPER:
00385                 if (!ss_site->ss_control_seq) {
00386                         CERROR("Sequence controller is not "
00387                                "initialized\n");
00388                         RETURN(-EINVAL);
00389                 }
00390                 rc = seq_server_alloc_super(ss_site->ss_control_seq, out, env);
00391                 break;
00392         default:
00393                 rc = -EINVAL;
00394                 break;
00395         }
00396 
00397         RETURN(rc);
00398 }
00399 
00400 static int seq_handler(struct tgt_session_info *tsi)
00401 {
00402         struct lu_seq_range     *out, *tmp;
00403         struct lu_site          *site;
00404         int                      rc;
00405         __u32                   *opc;
00406 
00407         ENTRY;
00408 
00409         LASSERT(!(lustre_msg_get_flags(tgt_ses_req(tsi)->rq_reqmsg) & MSG_REPLAY));
00410         site = tsi->tsi_exp->exp_obd->obd_lu_dev->ld_site;
00411         LASSERT(site != NULL);
00412 
00413         opc = req_capsule_client_get(tsi->tsi_pill, &RMF_SEQ_OPC);
00414         if (opc != NULL) {
00415                 out = req_capsule_server_get(tsi->tsi_pill, &RMF_SEQ_RANGE);
00416                 if (out == NULL)
00417                         RETURN(err_serious(-EPROTO));
00418 
00419                 tmp = req_capsule_client_get(tsi->tsi_pill, &RMF_SEQ_RANGE);
00420 
00421                 /* seq client passed mdt id, we need to pass that using out
00422                  * range parameter */
00423 
00424                 out->lsr_index = tmp->lsr_index;
00425                 out->lsr_flags = tmp->lsr_flags;
00426                 rc = seq_server_handle(site, tsi->tsi_env, *opc, out);
00427         } else {
00428                 rc = err_serious(-EPROTO);
00429         }
00430 
00431         RETURN(rc);
00432 }
00433 
00434 struct tgt_handler seq_handlers[] = {
00435 TGT_SEQ_HDL(HABEO_REFERO,       SEQ_QUERY,      seq_handler),
00436 };
00437 EXPORT_SYMBOL(seq_handlers);

00440 LU_KEY_INIT_FINI(seq, struct seq_thread_info);
00441 
00442 /* context key: seq_thread_key */
00443 LU_CONTEXT_KEY_DEFINE(seq, LCT_MD_THREAD | LCT_DT_THREAD);
00444 
00445 extern const struct file_operations seq_fld_proc_seq_fops;
00446 
00447 static int seq_server_proc_init(struct lu_server_seq *seq)
00448 {
00449 #ifdef CONFIG_PROC_FS
00450         int rc;
00451         ENTRY;
00452 
00453         seq->lss_proc_dir = lprocfs_register(seq->lss_name,
00454                                              seq_type_proc_dir,
00455                                              NULL, NULL);
00456         if (IS_ERR(seq->lss_proc_dir)) {
00457                 rc = PTR_ERR(seq->lss_proc_dir);
00458                 RETURN(rc);
00459         }
00460 
00461         rc = lprocfs_add_vars(seq->lss_proc_dir, seq_server_proc_list, seq);
00462         if (rc) {
00463                 CERROR("%s: Can't init sequence manager "
00464                        "proc, rc %d\n", seq->lss_name, rc);
00465                 GOTO(out_cleanup, rc);
00466         }
00467 
00468         if (seq->lss_type == LUSTRE_SEQ_CONTROLLER) {
00469                 rc = lprocfs_seq_create(seq->lss_proc_dir, "fldb", 0644,
00470                                         &seq_fld_proc_seq_fops, seq);
00471                 if (rc) {
00472                         CERROR("%s: Can't create fldb for sequence manager "
00473                                "proc: rc = %d\n", seq->lss_name, rc);
00474                         GOTO(out_cleanup, rc);
00475                 }
00476         }
00477 
00478         RETURN(0);
00479 
00480 out_cleanup:
00481         seq_server_proc_fini(seq);
00482         return rc;
00483 #else /* !CONFIG_PROC_FS */
00484         return 0;
00485 #endif /* CONFIG_PROC_FS */
00486 }
00487 
00488 static void seq_server_proc_fini(struct lu_server_seq *seq)
00489 {
00490 #ifdef CONFIG_PROC_FS
00491         ENTRY;
00492         if (seq->lss_proc_dir != NULL) {
00493                 if (!IS_ERR(seq->lss_proc_dir))
00494                         lprocfs_remove(&seq->lss_proc_dir);
00495                 seq->lss_proc_dir = NULL;
00496         }
00497         EXIT;
00498 #endif /* CONFIG_PROC_FS */
00499 }
00500 
00501 int seq_server_init(const struct lu_env *env,
00502                     struct lu_server_seq *seq,
00503                     struct dt_device *dev,
00504                     const char *prefix,
00505                     enum lu_mgr_type type,
00506                     struct seq_server_site *ss)
00507 {
00508         int rc, is_srv = (type == LUSTRE_SEQ_SERVER);
00509         ENTRY;
00510 
00511         LASSERT(dev != NULL);
00512         LASSERT(prefix != NULL);
00513         LASSERT(ss != NULL);
00514         LASSERT(ss->ss_lu != NULL);
00515 
00516         /* A compile-time check for FIDs that used to be in lustre_idl.h
00517          * but is moved here to remove CLASSERT/LASSERT in that header.
00518          * Check all lu_fid fields are converted in fid_cpu_to_le() and friends
00519          * and that there is no padding added by compiler to the struct. */
00520         {
00521                 struct lu_fid tst;
00522 
00523                 CLASSERT(sizeof(tst) == sizeof(tst.f_seq) +
00524                          sizeof(tst.f_oid) + sizeof(tst.f_ver));
00525         }
00526 
00527         seq->lss_cli = NULL;
00528         seq->lss_type = type;
00529         seq->lss_site = ss;
00530         lu_seq_range_init(&seq->lss_space);
00531 
00532         lu_seq_range_init(&seq->lss_lowater_set);
00533         lu_seq_range_init(&seq->lss_hiwater_set);
00534         seq->lss_set_width = LUSTRE_SEQ_BATCH_WIDTH;
00535 
00536         mutex_init(&seq->lss_mutex);
00537 
00538         seq->lss_width = is_srv ?
00539                 LUSTRE_SEQ_META_WIDTH : LUSTRE_SEQ_SUPER_WIDTH;
00540 
00541         snprintf(seq->lss_name, sizeof(seq->lss_name),
00542                  "%s-%s", (is_srv ? "srv" : "ctl"), prefix);
00543 
00544         rc = seq_store_init(seq, env, dev);
00545         if (rc)
00546                 GOTO(out, rc);
00547         /* Request backing store for saved sequence info. */
00548         rc = seq_store_read(seq, env);
00549         if (rc == -ENODATA) {
00550 
00551                 /* Nothing is read, init by default value. */
00552                 seq->lss_space = is_srv ?
00553                         LUSTRE_SEQ_ZERO_RANGE:
00554                         LUSTRE_SEQ_SPACE_RANGE;
00555 
00556                 seq->lss_space.lsr_index = ss->ss_node_id;
00557                 LCONSOLE_INFO("%s: No data found "
00558                               "on store. Initialize space\n",
00559                               seq->lss_name);
00560 
00561                 rc = seq_store_update(env, seq, NULL, 0);
00562                 if (rc) {
00563                         CERROR("%s: Can't write space data, "
00564                                "rc %d\n", seq->lss_name, rc);
00565                 }
00566         } else if (rc) {
00567                 CERROR("%s: Can't read space data, rc %d\n",
00568                        seq->lss_name, rc);
00569                 GOTO(out, rc);
00570         }
00571 
00572         if (is_srv) {
00573                 LASSERT(lu_seq_range_is_sane(&seq->lss_space));
00574         } else {
00575                 LASSERT(!lu_seq_range_is_zero(&seq->lss_space) &&
00576                         lu_seq_range_is_sane(&seq->lss_space));
00577         }
00578 
00579         rc  = seq_server_proc_init(seq);
00580         if (rc)
00581                 GOTO(out, rc);
00582 
00583         EXIT;
00584 out:
00585         if (rc)
00586                 seq_server_fini(seq, env);
00587         return rc;
00588 }
00589 EXPORT_SYMBOL(seq_server_init);
00590 
00591 void seq_server_fini(struct lu_server_seq *seq,
00592                      const struct lu_env *env)
00593 {
00594         ENTRY;
00595 
00596         seq_server_proc_fini(seq);
00597         seq_store_fini(seq, env);
00598 
00599         EXIT;
00600 }
00601 EXPORT_SYMBOL(seq_server_fini);
00602 
00603 int seq_site_fini(const struct lu_env *env, struct seq_server_site *ss)
00604 {
00605         if (ss == NULL)
00606                 RETURN(0);
00607 
00608         if (ss->ss_server_seq) {
00609                 seq_server_fini(ss->ss_server_seq, env);
00610                 OBD_FREE_PTR(ss->ss_server_seq);
00611                 ss->ss_server_seq = NULL;
00612         }
00613 
00614         if (ss->ss_control_seq) {
00615                 seq_server_fini(ss->ss_control_seq, env);
00616                 OBD_FREE_PTR(ss->ss_control_seq);
00617                 ss->ss_control_seq = NULL;
00618         }
00619 
00620         if (ss->ss_client_seq) {
00621                 seq_client_fini(ss->ss_client_seq);
00622                 OBD_FREE_PTR(ss->ss_client_seq);
00623                 ss->ss_client_seq = NULL;
00624         }
00625 
00626         RETURN(0);
00627 }
00628 EXPORT_SYMBOL(seq_site_fini);
00629 
00630 int fid_server_mod_init(void)
00631 {
00632         LU_CONTEXT_KEY_INIT(&seq_thread_key);
00633         return lu_context_key_register(&seq_thread_key);
00634 }
00635 
00636 void fid_server_mod_exit(void)
00637 {
00638         lu_context_key_degister(&seq_thread_key);
